Key Match Events: West Indies survived a late scare to beat India by two wickets with seven balls remaining.
Nicholas Pooran top-scored for West Indies with 67 runs in 40 balls.
Mukesh Kumar dismissed Nicholas Pooran, triggering a collapse from 126-4 to 129-8.
Akeal Hosein and Alzarri Joseph shared an unbroken 26-run stand to take West Indies to 155-8 in 18.5 overs.
Hardik Pandya was India’s most successful bowler with 3-35 in four overs.
Tilak Varma top-scored for India with a 41-ball 51.
Hosein, Joseph, and Romario Shepherd each took two wickets for West Indies.
Pre-Game Insights: India made one change with Ravi Bishnoi replacing injured Kuldeep Yadav.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The victory gives West Indies a 2-0 lead in the five-match contest.
The teams will stay in Providence, Guyana, for the third T20 on Tuesday, with the final two matches set for Lauderhill, Florida, on Aug. 12 and 13.
